intro: Onobrychis cornuta f. litvinovii, commonly known as the Litvinov's goat's rue, is a rare and endemic plant species native to specific regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive, spiny pods and trifoliate leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its flowers are usually pale purple or white, and it plays a minor but ecologically significant role in its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
